definition: Guanzi or Guan Zhong 管仲 (-645 BC), famous politician of Qi 齊國|齐国 of Spring and Autumn period/Guanzi, classical book containing writings of Guan Zhong and his school

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A blocked vent had caused the tank to buckle.
sentences.chinese: 有一条封闭的管子使罐子紧扣。

sentences.english: Pipe beveling machine is used for lifting raw materials.
sentences.chinese: 管子坡口机是用于起重机械的原材料。

sentences.english: The water was shut off for several hours while the plumber repaired the pipes.
sentences.chinese: 管子工修理管道时，水的供应中断了几个小时。

sentences.english: The inside of the pipe needs welding and grinding.
Various pressures were achieved with wide or narrow pipes.
sentences.chinese: 宽窄不一样的管子就会制造出不同的水压。

sentences.english: The generator shall be in the horizontal position with the tube oriented horizontally.
sentences.chinese: 卧置的发电机上连接的那根管子的走向应呈水平方向。

sentences.english: Water was leaking from pipe in the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 水顺着管子渗到浴室里。

sentences.english: Water will come out of this tube and flow into the bowl.
sentences.chinese: 水会从这条管子流出，再留进碗里。

sentences.english: Now lets place some secondary shapes, rings around the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 现在放些二级形，环绕管子的圆环。

sentences.english: A molten metal moves from a crucible into a vacuum chamber through a tube.
sentences.chinese: 熔融金属通过一根管子从熔炉进入真空室。

sentences.english: Finally both the flea and fly managed to flee through a flaw in the flue。
sentences.chinese: 最后，两个都设法通过那管子的一个裂隙逃走了。

sentences.english: Water your plants from the opening in the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 从管子的开口处灌溉你的植物。

sentences.english: Handle the tube carefully , or you will break it .
sentences.chinese: 小心拿住管子，否则会打碎的。

sentences.english: The hot vapour spouted from a rusted pipe.
sentences.chinese: 热蒸汽从一个生了锈的管子里喷了出来。

sentences.english: The water is leaking out of the pipe.
Water spouted from the break of the pipe.
